verses.roman:
sa tvaṁ bhūdhara-bhūtānāṁ
daitya-pramatha-rakṣasām
avatīrṇo vināśāya
sādhunāṁ rakṣaṇāya ca

synonyms: saḥ—He; tvam—Yourself; bhū-dhara—as kings; bhūtānām—who are appearing; daitya-pramatha-rakṣasām—of various kinds of demons; avatīrṇaḥ—You have descended; vināśāya—for the destruction; sādhūnām—of saintly persons; rakṣaṇāya—for the protection; ca—and.
translation: You, that very same creator, have now descended on the earth to annihilate the Daitya, Pramatha and Rākṣasa demons who are posing as kings, and also to protect the godly.
